init_time.description: The time it takes to import/initialize the tracer on startup. If this consists of multiple steps/components, tagged by the component/total e.g. `component:call_target`. Component tags will vary by language

logs_created.description: The number of logs created with a given log level. Useful for calculating impact for other features (automatic sending of logs). Levels should be one of `debug`, `info`, `warn`, `error`, `critical`

integration_errors.description: The number of errors/failures in the library integration, tagged by the integration name (e.g. `integration_name:kafka`, `integration_name:rabbitmq`) and ErrorType (e.g. `error:duck_type`, `error:runtime`). Both tags will vary by implementation language

otel.env.hiding.description: The number of Opentelemetry configuration keys, configured and supported, but overridden by its counterpart Datadog Configuration key, tagged by Datadog configuration key and Opentelemetry configuration key

otel.env.invalid.description: The number of configured supported Opentelemetry configuration keys that we fail to map its value to the Datadog form, tagged by Datadog configuration key and Opentelemetry configuration key

otel.env.unsupported.description: The number of unsupported (not having a mapping with any Datadog configuration key) configured Opentelemetry Configuration keys, tagged by Opentelemetry configuration key

spans_created.description: The number of spans created by the tracer, tagged by automatic integration name (e.g. `integration_name:kafka`, `integration_name:rabbitmq`) or manual API (`integration_name:datadog`, `integration_name:otel` or `integration_name:opentracing`)

spans_finished.description: The number of spans finished, optionally (if implementation allows) tagged by automatic integration name (e.g. `integration_name:kafka`, `integration_name:rabbitmq`) or manual API (`integration_name:datadog`, `integration_name:otel` or `integration_name:opentracing`)

spans_enqueued_for_serialization.description: The number of spans enqueued for serialization/flushing. Tagged by one of `reason:p0_keep` (the span was part of a p0 trace that was kept for sending to the agent), `reason:single_span_sampling` (the span was selected via single_span_sampling, and otherwise would have been dropped as a p0 span), or `reason:default` - The tracer is not dropping p0 spans, so the span was enqueued 'by default' for sending to the trace-agent)

spans_dropped.description: The number of spans dropped and the reason for being dropped, for example `reason:p0_drop` (the span was part of a p0 trace that was droped by the tracer), `reason:overfull_buffer` (the local buffer was full, and the span had to be dropped), `reason:serialization_error` (there was an error serializing the span and it had to be dropped)

trace_segments_created.description: The number of trace segments (local traces) created, tagged with new/continued depending on whether this is a new trace (no distributed context information) or continued (has distributed context).

trace_chunks_enqueued.description: The number of times a trace chunk is enqueued for sampling/serialization. In partial-flush scenarios, multiple trace chunks may be enququed per trace segment/local trace

trace_chunk_size.description: The number of spans in the trace chunk when it is enqueued

trace_chunk_serialization.bytes.description: The size in bytes of the serialized trace chunk

trace_chunk_serialization.ms.description: The time it takes to serialize a trace chunk

trace_chunks_enqueued_for_serialization.description: The number of trace chunks kept for serialization. Excludes single-span sampling spans. Tagged by one of `reason:p0_keep` (the trace was a p0 trace that was kept for sending to the agent) or `reason:default` - The tracer is not dropping p0 spans, so the span was enqueued 'by default' for sending to the trace-agent)

trace_chunks_dropped.description: the number of trace chunks dropped prior to serialization, tagged by reason. Includes traces which are dropped due to errors, overfull buffers, as well as due to sampling decision. For example `reason:p0_drop` (the span a p0 trace that was droped by the tracer), `reason:overfull_buffer` (the local buffer was full, and the trace chunk had to be dropped), `reason:serialization_error` (there was an error serializing the trace and it had to be dropped)

trace_chunks_sent.description: The number of trace chunks attempted to be sent to the backend, regardless of response

trace_segments_closed.description: The number of trace segments (local traces) closed. In non partial flush scenarios, trace_segments_closed == trace_chunks_enqueued

trace_api.requests.description: The number of requests sent to the trace endopint in the agent, regardless of success

trace_api.bytes.description: The size of the payload sent to the endpoint in bytes

trace_api.ms.description: The time it takes to flush the trace payload to the agent. Note that this is not the per trace time, this is the per payload time

trace_api.responses.description: The number of responses received from the trace endpoint, tagged with status code, e.g. `status_code:200`, `status_code:404`. May also use `status_code:5xx` for example as a catch-all for 2xx, 3xx, 4xx, 5xx responses

trace_api.errors.description: The number of requests sent to the trace endpoint in the agent that errored, tagged by the error type (e.g. `type:timeout`, `type:network`, `type:status_code`)

trace_partial_flush.count.description: The number of times a partial flush (where a span is flushed separately from its local root span) is triggered, tagged by the reason the flush was triggered (`reason:large_trace`, `reason:single_span_ingestion`)

trace_partial_flush.spans_closed.description: The number of spans included in the trace chunk when partial flush is triggered

trace_partial_flush.spans_remaining.description: The number of open spans remaining in the trace segment (local trace) when partial flush is triggered

context_header_style.injected.description: The number of times distributed context is injected into an outgoing span, tagged by header style (`header_style:tracecontext`, `header_style:datadog`, `header_style:b3multi`, `header_style:b3single`)

context_header_style.extracted.description: The number of times distributed context is successfully extracted from an outgoing span, tagged by header style (`header_style:tracecontext`, `header_style:datadog`, `header_style:b3multi`, `header_style:b3single`)

stats_buckets.description: The number of unique buckets created for stats aggregation

stats_api.requests.description: The number of requests sent to the stats endopint in the agent, regardless of success

stats_api.bytes.description: The size of the payload sent to the stats endpoint in bytes

stats_api.ms.description: The time it takes to send the payload sent to the endpoint in ms

stats_api.responses.description: The number of responses received from the endpoint, tagged with status code, e.g. `status_code:200`, `status_code:404`. May also use `status_code:5xx` for example as a catch-all for 2xx, 3xx, 4xx, 5xx responses

stats_api.errors.description: The number of requests sent to the api endpoint in the agent that errored, tagged by the error type (e.g. Timeout, NetworkError, StatusCode)

inject.success.description: Number of successful injections of APM libraries

inject.skip.description: Number of skipped injections of APM libraries

inject.error.description: Number of erroneous injections of APM libraries

host_lib_injection.success.description: Number of successful host lib injection

host_lib_injection.failure.description: Number of failed host lib injection

k8s_lib_injection.success.description: Number of successful k8s lib injection

k8s_lib_injection.failure.description: Number of failed host k8s injection

docker_lib_injection.success.description: Number of successful docker lib injection

docker_lib_injection.failure.description: Number of failed docker lib injection

library_entrypoint.abort.description: Number of injections aborted at library entrypoint due to checks not passing

library_entrypoint.abort.runtime.description: Number of injections aborted at library entrypoint due to runtime version not supported

library_entrypoint.abort.integration.description: Number of injections aborted at library entrypoint due to integration version not supported

library_entrypoint.error.description: Number of injections aborted at library entrypoint due to an error

library_entrypoint.complete.description: Number of successful library entrypoint injections

entry.process.running.1s.description: Number of injections that are still running after 1s

entry.process.running.5s.description: Number of injections that are still running after 5s

entry.process.running.10s.description: Number of injections that are still running after 10s

exporter_fallback.description: Number of times the libdatadog trace exporter isn't used and we fallback on the previous implementation

telemetry_api.requests.description: The number of requests sent to a telemetry endopint, regardless of success, tagged by the endpoint (`endpoint:agent`, `endpoint:agentless`)

telemetry_api.bytes.description: The size of the payload sent to the stats endpoint in bytes, tagged by the endpoint (`endpoint:agent`, `endpoint:agentless`)

telemetry_api.ms.description: The time it takes to send the payload sent to the endpoint in ms, tagged by the endpoint (`endpoint:agent`, `endpoint:agentless`)

telemetry_api.responses.description: The number of requests sent to the api endpoint in the agent that errored, tagged by the error type (e.g. `type:timeout`, `type:network`, `type:status_code`)

telemetry_api.errors.description: The number of requests sent to the api endpoint in the agent that errored, tagged by the error type (e.g. `type:timeout`, `type:network`, `type:status_code`) and Endpoint (`endpoint:agent`, `endpoint:agentless`)

waf.init.description: Number of times we is initialized

waf.updates.description: Number of times we reload the rules (startup + Remote Configuration)

waf.input_truncated.description: Count of times a WAF input was truncated

waf.truncated_value_size.description: Un-truncated size of truncated WAF inputs

waf.config_errors.description: Count of errors reported by the WAF on about particular config item

rasp.rule.eval.description: Counts the number of times a rule type is evaluated

rasp.rule.match.description: Counts the number of times a rule type has a match

rasp.timeout.description: Counts the number of times a timeout was hit when evaluating a specific rule type

instrum.user_auth.missing_user_id.description: Number of user events skipped due to not having a user id

instrumented.source.description: Number of source call sites instrumented

instrumented.propagation.description: Number of propagation call sites instrumented

instrumented.sink.description: Number of sink call sites instrumented

executed.source.description: Number of source call sites executed

executed.propagation.description: Number of propagation call sites executed

executed.sink.description: Number of sink call sites executed

executed.tainted.description: Number of taint operations triggered during a request

request.tainted.description: Number of tainted values at the end of a request

json.tag.size.exceeded.description: Number of times that _dd.iast.json tag exceeds the maximum span tag size

server.active_sessions.description: Number of sessions active in parallel

server.submitted_payloads.description: Number of payloads the sidecar has processed

test_session.description: The number of test sessions started. Tagged with CI provider (15 possible values) and a boolean flag set to true if the session is run by a tracer that was auto-injected

event_created.description: The number of events created, tagged by event type (possible values are: `event_type:test`, `event_type:suite`, `event_type:module` or `event_type:session`), testing framework name (e.g. `test_framework:xunit`, `test_framework:nunit`, `test_framework:jest`) . Also, if the event_type is `session` two boolean tags will be set (has_codeowner and unsupported_ci), if the event_type is `test` a boolean `is_benchmark` flag will be set.

event_finished.description: The number of events finished, tagged by event type (possible values are: `event_type:test`, `event_type:suite`, `event_type:module` or `event_type:session`), testing framework name (e.g. `test_framework:xunit`, `test_framework:nunit`, `test_framework:jest`) . If the event_type is `session` two boolean tags will be set (`has_codeowner` and `unsupported_ci`) and additional string tag might be set (`early_flake_detection_abort_reason` if early flakiness detection feature was aborted for that particular session; currently has only one possible value: `faulty`). If the event_type is `test` boolean `is_benchmark`, `is_new`, `is_rum` flags will be set (if `is_rum` is set, additional `browser_driver` tag will be added, which currently has only one possible value; if `is_new` is set, additional `early_flake_detection_abort_reason` tag will be added, which currently has only one possible value).

code_coverage_started.description: The number of code coverage sessions started tagged by the code coverage library name (e.g. `library:custom`, `library:jacoco`, `library:builtin`) and testing framework name (e.g. `test_framework:xunit`, `test_framework:nunit`, `test_framework:jest`)

code_coverage_finished.description: The number of code coverage sessions finished, optionally (if implementation allows) tagget by the code coverage library name  (e.g. `library:custom`, `library:jacoco`, `library:builtin`) and testing framework name (e.g. `test_framework:xunit`, `test_framework:nunit`, `test_framework:jest`)

manual_api_events.description: The number of events created used by the manual api tagged by the event type (possible values are: `event_type:test`, `event_type:suite`, `event_type:module` or `event_type:session`)

events_enqueued_for_serialization.description: The number of events enqueued for serialization

endpoint_payload.bytes.description: The size in bytes of the serialized payload, tagged by endpoint type (possible values are: `endpoint:test_cycle` or `endpoint:code_coverage`)

endpoint_payload.requests.description: The number of requests sent to the endpoint, regardless of success, tagged by endpoint type (possible values are: `endpoint:test_cycle` or `endpoint:code_coverage`) and a boolean flag set to true if request body is compressed

endpoint_payload.dropped.description: The number of payloads dropped after all retries, tagged by endpoint type (possible values are: `endpoint:test_cycle` or `endpoint:code_coverage`)

endpoint_payload.requests_ms.description: The time it takes to send the payload sent to the endpoint in ms, tagged by endpoint type (possible values are: `endpoint:test_cycle` or `endpoint:code_coverage`)

endpoint_payload.requests_errors.description: The number of requests sent to the endpoint that errored, tagget by the error type (e.g. `error_type:timeout`, `error_type:network`, `error_type:status_code`) and endpoint type (possible values are: `endpoint:test_cycle` or `endpoint:code_coverage`) and status code (400,401,403,404,408,429)

endpoint_payload.events_count.description: The number of events included in the payload, tagged by endpoint type (possible values are: `endpoint:test_cycle` or `endpoint:code_coverage`)

endpoint_payload.events_serialization_ms.description: The time it takes to serialize the payload, tagged by endpoint type (possible values are: `endpoint:test_cycle` or `endpoint:code_coverage`)

git.command.description: The number of git commands executed, tagged by command type (possible values are: `command:get_repository`, `command:get_branch`, `command:check_shallow`, `command:unshallow`, `command:get_local_commits`, `command:get_objects`, `command:pack_objects`)

git.command_errors.description: The number of git command that errored, tagged by command type (possible values are: `command:get_repository`, `command:get_branch`, `command:check_shallow`, `command:unshallow`, `command:get_local_commits`, `command:get_objects`, `command:pack_objects`) and the exit code of the command.

git.command_ms.description: The time it takes to execute the git command, tagged by command type (possible values are: `command:get_repository`, `command:get_branch`, `command:check_shallow`, `command:unshallow`, `command:get_local_commits`, `command:get_objects`, `command:pack_objects`)

git_requests.search_commits.description: The number of requests sent to the search commit endpoint, regardless of success. Tagged with a boolean flag set to true if request body is compressed

git_requests.search_commits_ms.description: The time it takes to get the response of the search commit request in ms

git_requests.search_commits_errors.description: The number of search commit requests sent to the endpoint that errored, tagget by the error type (e.g. `error_type:timeout`, `error_type:network`, `error_type:status_code_4xx_response`, `error_type:status_code_5xx_response`) and status code (400,401,403,404,408,429)

git_requests.objects_pack.description: The number of requests sent to the git object pack endpoint, regardless of success. Tagged with a boolean flag set to true if request body is compressed

git_requests.objects_pack_ms.description: The time it takes to get the response of the git object pack request in ms

git_requests.objects_pack_errors.description: The number of git object pack requests sent to the endpoint that errored, tagget by the error type (e.g. `error_type:timeout`, `error_type:network`, `error_type:status_code_4xx_response`, `error_type:status_code_5xx_response`) and status code (400,401,403,404,408,429)

git_requests.objects_pack_bytes.description: The sum of the sizes of the object pack files inside a single payload

git_requests.objects_pack_files.description: The number of files sent in the object pack payload

git_requests.settings.description: The number of requests sent to the settings endpoint, regardless of success. Tagged with a boolean flag set to true if request body is compressed

git_requests.settings_ms.description: The time it takes to get the response of the settings endpoint request in ms

git_requests.settings_errors.description: The number of settings requests sent to the endpoint that errored, tagget by the error type  (e.g. `error_type:timeout`, `error_type:network`, `error_type:status_code_4xx_response`, `error_type:status_code_5xx_response`) and status code (400,401,403,404,408,429)

git_requests.settings_response.description: The number of settings responses from the endpoint tagged with `coverage_enabled`, `itrskip_enabled` or `early_flake_detection_enabled` flags (if corresponding boolean settings are set in the response)

itr_skippable_tests.request.description: The number of requests sent to the itr skippable tests endpoint, regardless of success. Tagged with a boolean flag set to true if request body is compressed

itr_skippable_tests.request_ms.description: The time it takes to get the response of the itr skippable tests endpoint request in ms

itr_skippable_tests.request_errors.description: The number of itr skippable tests requests sent to the endpoint that errored, tagget by the error type  (e.g. `error_type:timeout`, `error_type:network`, `error_type:status_code_4xx_response`, `error_type:status_code_5xx_response`) and status code (400,401,403,404,408,429)

itr_skippable_tests.response_bytes.description: The number of bytes received by the endpoint. Tagged with a boolean flag set to true if response body is compressed

itr_skippable_tests.response_tests.description: The number of tests to skip returned by the endpoint

itr_skippable_tests.response_suites.description: The number of suites to skip returned by the endpoint

itr_skipped.description: The number of tests or test suites skipped tagged by event type (possible values are: `event_type:test`, `event_type:suite`)

itr_unskippable.description: The number of tests or test suites that are seen as unskippable tagged by event type (possible values are: `event_type:test`, `event_type:suite`)

itr_forced_run.description: The number of tests or test suites that would've been skipped by ITR but were forced to run because of their unskippable status tagged by event type (possible values are: `event_type:test`, `event_type:suite`)

code_coverage.is_empty.description: The number of successfully collected code coverages that are empty

code_coverage.files.description: The number of files covered inside a coverage payload

code_coverage.errors.description: The number of errors while processing code coverage

early_flake_detection.request.description: The number of requests sent to the known tests endpoint, regardless of success. Tagged with a boolean flag set to true if request body is compressed

early_flake_detection.request_ms.description: The time it takes to get the response of the known tests endpoint request in ms

early_flake_detection.request_errors.description: The number of known tests requests sent to the endpoint that errored, tagget by the error type  (e.g. `error_type:timeout`, `error_type:network`, `error_type:status_code_4xx_response`, `error_type:status_code_5xx_response`) and status code (400,401,403,404,408,429)

early_flake_detection.response_bytes.description: The number of bytes received by the endpoint. Tagged with a boolean flag set to true if response body is compressed

early_flake_detection.response_tests.description: The number of known tests returned by the endpoint

ssi_heuristic.number_of_profiles.description: The number of profiles that would have been hypothetically emitted if SSI was enabled for profiling

ssi_heuristic.number_of_runtime_id.description: The number of runtimes that would have been hypothetically profiled if SSI was enabled for profiling
